intro: Dicliptera carvalhoi subsp. laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered dicliptera, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered inflorescences. The leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, with a smooth surface and a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open areas such as grasslands and disturbed sites. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
